entry.title: Interior Plains
entry.content:
The trail behind is long; still longer up ahead.
The land is dry and barren, unwatered and unfed.
This is no place to be, yet here I’ve always been,
I’ve walked this walk forever, trapped in the waste within.
I have to walk still further, to hope that change is near,
But all the nerves are blunted to promises or fear.
No one has been searching … now back up on my feet …
Up high the vultures circle, fresh carrion to eat.

entry.title: The Final Crucible
entry.content:
The drums are beating more,
Internal drums of war.
Descending for this fight
Over the walls of night,
The die has now been cast,
Event horizon passed,
And stakes and perils loom –
The crucible of doom.
The fate we must defy,
To get to live – or die
In this empty gloom
Where dreams may find their tomb –
And exorcise all fear:
The judgement is now near.
This path must pay its cost…
But nothing is yet lost.
This soul decayed and starved
Must be reforged, recarved,
Rewired to its core.
The war drums howl and roar,
Old selves recoil and thrash
The old path paved with ash,
The old path paved with lore
Now opens the last door
To love, to life, to more.
A march to final war.

entry.title: Soul Reduction
entry.content:
The soul wanders, the will falters. The world, impossibly mundane.
All wants vying, all dreams dying. The soul throbs against the grain.
New rounds of hope, and joy, illusions, birth crushed delusions, without fail.
The thoughts, compelling, strong, and dark. Like a fortress … or a jail (?).

The green light across the bay consumes the future, haunts the past;
All reserves of optimism almost emptied now, at last.
A special gift, or hateful curse, the soul fluctuates and waits.
Then god, then prisoner, now what? The Dark Lord at Angband's gates.
